result.execSummary:
The defendant William Markus Adkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Markus Adkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Markus Adkins was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to sentences defendant is currently serving in Racine County cases (12CF220, 12CF424 & 12CF549).

superMiscConds.notes: including $600 drug reimbursement.  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge if required by statute.
No consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless approved by Dr. and according to Dr.'s orders.  Prescriptions as approved by agent.
Follow through with counseling, assessments and treatment as recommended by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
